header: Cri. B.A. No. 88/19. Cri. Bail Application No.88/19. Hura Usman Shaikh etc. Vs. State. (CNR â€“ MHPU01- 000363 -2019 )

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 (Passed on this 24th day of January, 2019) This is an application for grant of bail under section 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, for the offence punishable under sections 498-A and 306 read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code in crime No. 230/18 registered with Dighi police station, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 498-a and 306 read with section 34 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] In short, the prosecution case is that the complainant Mehboob Farid Shaikh lodged report to police station Dighi inter alia contending that the complainant is having 5 married daughters. His daughter Irfana Abdul Shaikh had got married with accused No.1 Abdul on 23-4-2018. He had given gold ornaments in the marriage, but the accused persons used to ask deceased that they have purchased plot at Pune and they are required to pay amount for the same and they want to sell those gold ornaments for that purpose. They demanded those ornaments to deceased, but she refused for the same. Therefore, the accused persons used to beat her, illtreat her physically and mentally and therefore due to illtreatment given by the accused, she was under stress and she committed suicide on 10-9-2018 by hanging 2 herself. The accused persons are responsible for the death of deceased and they have abetted commission of suicide by her. Therefore, offence was registered against the accused persons for the offence under sections 498-A and 306 read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code vide crime No. 230/18.

argumentSentences.text: 2] In short, the prosecution case is that the complainant Mehboob Farid Shaikh lodged report to police station Dighi inter alia contending that the complainant is having 5 married daughters.
His daughter Irfana Abdul Shaikh had got married with accused No.1 Abdul on 23-4-2018.

He had given gold ornaments in the marriage, but the accused persons used to ask deceased that they have purchased plot at Pune and they are required to pay amount for the same and they want to sell those gold ornaments for that purpose.
They demanded those ornaments to deceased, but she refused for the same.

Therefore, the accused persons used to beat her, illtreat her physically and mentally and therefore due to illtreatment given by the accused, she was under stress and she committed suicide on 10-9-2018 by hanging 2 herself.
The accused persons are responsible for the death of deceased and they have abetted commission of suicide by her.
Therefore, offence was registered against the accused persons for the offence under sections 498-A and 306 read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code vide crime No. 230/18.

arguments.text: 3] The contention of the applicants/accused is that offence alleged to have been by the accused is not punishable with imprisonment for life or death. They have not committed any offence as alleged nor participated in commission of it. They have been falsely implicated. The applicants are permanent resident of Charholi Bk., Tal. Haveli, Dist. Pune. There is no criminal record or conviction against the applicants. They will not tamper with prosecution evidence. They are ready to abide by the terms and conditions that may be imposed by this Court. They are ready and willing to cooperate with the investigating agency. Lastly, they prayed to release them on bail.

They have not committed any offence as alleged nor participated in commission of it.

They are ready and willing to cooperate with the investigating agency.
Lastly, they prayed to release them on bail.

arguments.text: 4] The application is opposed by learned A.P.P. by filing say Exh.3 on the count that if the applicants are released on bail, they will pressurize the prosecution witnesses, they will destroy the evidence and they will not 3 Cri. B.A. No. 88/19. be present in Court for trial. The investigation is in progress. Hence, he prayed to reject the application.

be present in Court for trial.
The investigation is in progress.
Hence, he prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Heard learned A.P.P. for the State and learned Advocate for the applicants. Gone through the case diary.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Heard learned A.P.P. for the State and learned Advocate for the applicants.
Gone through the case diary.

arguments.text: 6] In view of these facts, following points arise for determination and findings thereon are recorded against each of them, for the reasons stated below : Points Findings 1.Whether the applicants are entitled for bail ? No. 2. What order ? As per final order. REASONS Point No.1 and 2 :-

argumentSentences.text: 6] In view of these facts, following points arise for determination and findings thereon are recorded against each of them, for the reasons stated below : Points Findings 1.
Whether the applicants are entitled for bail ?
No. 2.
What order ?
As per final order.
REASONS Point No.1 and 2 :-

arguments.text: 7] On perusal of the contents of F.I.R., it clearly reveals that the marriage of accused No.1 and deceased was performed on 23-4-2018 and she has committed suicide on 10-9-2018. The death of deceased is within five months of marriage. The contents of FIR clearly reveals that the accused persons along with other accused persons have illtreated deceased for demand of amount for giving amount to plot owner. The accused 4 persons also demanded gold ornaments to deceased to sell and to pay the amount to the plot owner. When she refused to hand over the ornaments, the accused persons beat herand illtreated her physically and mentally and due to illtreatment, she was under pressure. On 10-9-2018, she committed suicide by hanging herself.

argumentSentences.text: 7] On perusal of the contents of F.I.R., it clearly reveals that the marriage of accused No.1 and deceased was performed on 23-4-2018 and she has committed suicide on 10-9-2018.
The death of deceased is within five months of marriage.
The contents of FIR clearly reveals that the accused persons along with other accused persons have illtreated deceased for demand of amount for giving amount to plot owner.
The accused 4 persons also demanded gold ornaments to deceased to sell and to pay the amount to the plot owner.
When she refused to hand over the ornaments, the accused persons beat herand illtreated her physically and mentally and due to illtreatment, she was under pressure.
On 10-9-2018, she committed suicide by hanging herself.

arguments.text: 8] In the supplementary statement recorded on 14-9-2018, the complainant has specifically stated that deceased Irfana had phone his another daughter Bipasha on 10-9-2018 at 6 a.m. and deceased has informed Bipasha that she should send their father with the dowry amount. The contents of FIR further clearly reveal that the accused persons along with other accused have illtreated the deceased for demand of dowry. It is a dowry death and she was being assaulted and illtreated for demand of amount. The death of deceased is doubtful. There are marks of assault on her body. Therefore, detailed investigation is necessary. Prima facie involvement of the accused appears in the offence in question. The investigation is in progress. The apprehension of the prosecution is well founded from the act of the accused. The offence is serious in nature.

argumentSentences.text: 8] In the supplementary statement recorded on 14-9-2018, the complainant has specifically stated that deceased Irfana had phone his another daughter Bipasha on 10-9-2018 at 6 a.m. and deceased has informed Bipasha that she should send their father with the dowry amount.
The contents of FIR further clearly reveal that the accused persons along with other accused have illtreated the deceased for demand of dowry.
It is a dowry death and she was being assaulted and illtreated for demand of amount.
The death of deceased is doubtful.
There are marks of assault on her body.
Therefore, detailed investigation is necessary.
Prima facie involvement of the accused appears in the offence in question.
The investigation is in progress.
The apprehension of the prosecution is well founded from the act of the accused.
The offence is serious in nature.

arguments.text: 9] Considering these facts and considering the 5 Cri. B.A. No. 88/19. nature and gravity of offence, and the act committed by the applicants/accused, the applicants have not made out prima facie case for their release on bail. Therefore, it is not just and desirable to enlarge them on bail. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order :-

nature and gravity of offence, and the act committed by the applicants/accused, the applicants have not made out prima facie case for their release on bail.
Therefore, it is not just and desirable to enlarge them on bail.
Hence, I proceed to pass the following order :-

processedText:
Cri. B.A. No. 88/19. Cri. Bail Application No.88/19. Hura Usman Shaikh etc. Vs. State. (CNR â€“ MHPU01- 000363 -2019 ) 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 (Passed on this 24th day of January, 2019) This is an application for grant of bail under section 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, for the offence punishable under sections 498-A and 306 read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code in crime No. 230/18 registered with Dighi police station, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] In short, the prosecution case is that the complainant Mehboob Farid Shaikh lodged report to police station Dighi inter alia contending that the complainant is having 5 married daughters. His daughter Irfana Abdul Shaikh had got married with accused No.1 Abdul on 23-4-2018. He had given gold ornaments in the marriage, but the accused persons used to ask deceased that they have purchased plot at Pune and they are required to pay amount for the same and they want to sell those gold ornaments for that purpose. They demanded those ornaments to deceased, but she refused for the same. Therefore, the accused persons used to beat her, illtreat her physically and mentally and therefore due to illtreatment given by the accused, she was under stress and she committed suicide on 10-9-2018 by hanging 2 herself. The accused persons are responsible for the death of deceased and they have abetted commission of suicide by her. Therefore, offence was registered against the accused persons for the offence under sections 498-A and 306 read with section 34 of the Indian Penal Code vide crime No. 230/18. 
---argument-ends---
3] The contention of the applicants/accused is that offence alleged to have been by the accused is not punishable with imprisonment for life or death. They have not committed any offence as alleged nor participated in commission of it. They have been falsely implicated. The applicants are permanent resident of Charholi Bk., Tal. Haveli, Dist. Pune. There is no criminal record or conviction against the applicants. They will not tamper with prosecution evidence. They are ready to abide by the terms and conditions that may be imposed by this Court. They are ready and willing to cooperate with the investigating agency. Lastly, they prayed to release them on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] The application is opposed by learned A.P.P. by filing say Exh.3 on the count that if the applicants are released on bail, they will pressurize the prosecution witnesses, they will destroy the evidence and they will not 3 Cri. B.A. No. 88/19. be present in Court for trial. The investigation is in progress. Hence, he prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Heard learned A.P.P. for the State and learned Advocate for the applicants. Gone through the case diary. 
---argument-ends---
6] In view of these facts, following points arise for determination and findings thereon are recorded against each of them, for the reasons stated below : Points Findings 1.Whether the applicants are entitled for bail ? No. 2. What order ? As per final order. REASONS Point No.1 and 2 :- 
---argument-ends---
7] On perusal of the contents of F.I.R., it clearly reveals that the marriage of accused No.1 and deceased was performed on 23-4-2018 and she has committed suicide on 10-9-2018. The death of deceased is within five months of marriage. The contents of FIR clearly reveals that the accused persons along with other accused persons have illtreated deceased for demand of amount for giving amount to plot owner. The accused 4 persons also demanded gold ornaments to deceased to sell and to pay the amount to the plot owner. When she refused to hand over the ornaments, the accused persons beat herand illtreated her physically and mentally and due to illtreatment, she was under pressure. On 10-9-2018, she committed suicide by hanging herself. 
---argument-ends---
8] In the supplementary statement recorded on 14-9-2018, the complainant has specifically stated that deceased Irfana had phone his another daughter Bipasha on 10-9-2018 at 6 a.m. and deceased has informed Bipasha that she should send their father with the dowry amount. The contents of FIR further clearly reveal that the accused persons along with other accused have illtreated the deceased for demand of dowry. It is a dowry death and she was being assaulted and illtreated for demand of amount. The death of deceased is doubtful. There are marks of assault on her body. Therefore, detailed investigation is necessary. Prima facie involvement of the accused appears in the offence in question. The investigation is in progress. The apprehension of the prosecution is well founded from the act of the accused. The offence is serious in nature. 
---argument-ends---
9] Considering these facts and considering the 5 Cri. B.A. No. 88/19. nature and gravity of offence, and the act committed by the applicants/accused, the applicants have not made out prima facie case for their release on bail. Therefore, it is not just and desirable to enlarge them on bail. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order :- 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Application (Exh.1) is hereby rejected. 
---order-ends---
(Mrs. Madhuri M. Deshpande) Date: 24-1-2019. Additional Session Judge, Pune. 6 I affirm that the contents of this PDF file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno: S.R.
